docblock.description: Creates a list of files in the working directory, sorts and reverses the list, and returns it.
docblock.long-description: Intended for working with blog posts stored as text files with date-coded filenames

docblock.description: Checks the number of files in the current directory and compares it to how many are listed in the current inventory.
docblock.long-description: If the number doesn't match, it returns False.

docblock.description: Regenerates the blog inventory file
Returns a random line of a given file.
docblock.long-description: Used mainly for generating random suggestions for additional blog posts to read.

docblock.description: Generates and displays a list of additional 'suggested' blog posts.
docblock.long-description:
Right now picks them randomly, but in the future might rely on a better algorithm.

Arguments: $number (int): how many to generate and display $tag (string): a tag or tags to use for generating suggestions

docblock.description: Lists the files in a directory and returns an array of them out to the given length section

tag.name: param
tag.description: (int) - a starting index for the files

tag.name: param
tag.description: (int) - an ending index for the files

tag.name: return
tag.description: (array) - an array of post objects

docblock.description: Contains everything to do with retrieving and outputting posts in multiple forms.
docblock.long-description:
Is capable of retrieving posts stored in .json format (preferred when available) as well as plaintext (file syntax described below in constructor).

Contains functions to output the post data in html format for displaying to a page, and atom format for use in generating an atom feed.

docblock.description: Reads and parses a post file and creates an instance of the class with the post data.
docblock.long-description: Capable of managing posts in json and plaintext, but prefers json if a json file exists for the requested post.

tag.name: param
tag.description: (string) - a yyyy.mm.dd string of a nodefile

docblock.description: Produces the coded output of the item that can be returned and displayed or saved in an atom feed
Produces the coded output of the item that can be displayed on an html page
Returns a string containing the post title and tags, suitable for outputting in an atom feed (maybe) or an html list
Retrieves and returns the requested field

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str) - the name of the field to return

docblock.description: Performs a 301 (permanent) redirect
Performs a 302 (temporary) redirect
Manages conditionally redirecting pages based on the requested uri and a given uri to redirect from.
docblock.long-description:
Checks to see if the uri requested by the user contains the uri to redirect from, and prepares to perform the redirect if so.

Relies on the redirect class to manage the actual redirecting, this class is primarly an interface to it that deals with the conditional aspect.

tag.description: - a uri to redirect to

tag.description: - the uri requested by the user

docblock.description: Provides a common interface for picking up variables from the user in a clean way, so that internal variables for pulling pages and otherwise can be managed more easily and sanitation settings are more easily applied site-wide.

docblock.description: Manages sanitizing user input.
docblock.long-description: Currently works only for strings, but adding functions to sanitize other data types is trivial. Retrieving sanitized values from the class involves invoking the __get function with the type, str, arr, bool, etc for whichever sanitation functions are implemented. The sanitization for the requested return is called (returns an empty object if the sanitization can't convert the current one to the requested one).

docblock.description: Constructs an instance of the class containing the original variable and the sanitized variable

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str) - the raw variable contents

tag.name: param
tag.description: (str) - the desired type for the variable to be

tag.name: param
tag.description: (int) - a maximum length for the variable

docblock.description: Returns a sanitized version of the variable.
docblock.long-description: If the requested type is not the same as the actual type, the class will attempt to convert it to the type if possible. Note that list cannot become a string.

tag.name: param
tag.description: - the type of data to return (str, bool, arr, etc)

tag.name: return
tag.description: a sanitized variable

docblock.description: Verify that a string is made of html-safe characters and short enough to fit where it belongs.
